title.value: Studying Logging Practice in Machine Learning-based Applications
title.justification: This is the exact title as found at the beginning of the provided research paper.
title.quote: Studying Logging Practice in Machine Learning-based Applications

extractions.description: This paper investigates the characteristics and practices of logging in ML-based applications. It contrasts these practices with those in traditional software applications and highlights the need for more ML-specific logging libraries. The analysis includes quantitative and qualitative studies of logging statements in 110 open-source ML-based projects from GitHub.

type.justification: The paper conducts an empirical study by quantitatively and qualitatively analyzing logging statements from ML-based projects on GitHub.
type.quote: In this paper, we conduct an empirical study on 110 open-source ML-based applications.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on logging practices, which falls under the domain of Software Engineering.
name.quote: This paper aims to fill this gap in the literature. Such a study could be useful for ML practitioners to understand logging practices in ML applications, identify the kind of information that is being logged, and the logging libraries used.

name.justification: The paper investigates the logging practices specifically in ML-based applications.
name.quote: Several research works have been done to investigate the different characteristics of logging practices in traditional software systems... In this paper, we aim to fill this knowledge gap and help ML practitioners understand the characteristics of logging in ML-based applications.

name.justification: Pytorch is mentioned as a popular library that facilitates and contributes to the development of ML applications.
name.quote: Today, there are many popular libraries that facilitate and contribute to the development of such applications, among which we can mention: Pytorch, Tensorflow, Theano, MXNet, Scikit-Learn, Caffe, and Keras.
